result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A McKibbin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant can work off the Fine and penalty amount ($199) by doing community service at $10 per hour.  20 hours of Community Service is needed to pay the $199 in full and is to be done by 7-17-15.  Verification of completed Community Service is to be turned in to the Clerk of Court office

The remaining balance of the Fine/costs/DNA Surcharge ($443) is to be paid at the rate of $25 per month, with the first payment due 6-1-15 and each subsequent payment will be due the 1st of every month thereafter until paid in full
.
